Documentation.long_help: This filter is a wrapped-pipeline to compute volumetrics for RVA supported data sets.

SourceProxy.name: CutBetweenWells
SourceProxy.label: Cut Between Wells

Documentation.long_help: This filter extracts cells on a Data Set that lie between two wells.

SourceProxy.Documentation:
The Cut Between Wells filter extracts the portions of the input dataset whose cells lie between the two selected wells.
The input can be any type of Data Set. The wells must be Poly Data. The result is an Unstructured Grid.

InputProperty.name: DataSet
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the Data Set to be evaluated by the Cut Between Wells filter.

InputProperty.name: WellOne
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the first well to be evaluated.

InputProperty.name: WellTwo
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the second well to be evaluated.

SourceProxy.name: ConnectedThresholdWithCustomSource
SourceProxy.label: Connected Threshold With Custom Source

Documentation.long_help: This filter extracts cells that have cell scalars in the specified range and are all connected to each other.
Documentation.short_help: Extract connected cells that satisfy a threshold criterion.

SourceProxy.Documentation:
The Connected Threshold With Custom Source filter extracts the portions of the input dataset whose scalars lie within the specified range and are connected. This connection begins at the Seed Points input. This filter operates only on cell-centered data. The input must be Image Data or a Rectilinear Grid. The resulting output type is the same as the input.
The filter can be set on two different scalars from the same object. The Lower Threshold and Upper Threshold sliders determine the range of the scalars to retain in the output. The Exclude Range checkbox will cause only the scalars below the Lower Threshold and above the Upper Threshold to be retained in the output.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to be evaluated by the Connected Threshold filter.

InputProperty.name: SeedPoints
InputProperty.label: Seed Points
InputProperty.Documentation: This input tells the Connected Threshold filter where to start evaluating.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputScalars
StringVectorProperty.label: Scalars 1
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property contains the name of the scalar array from which to perform thresholding.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: LowerThreshold1
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Lower Threshold 1
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property specifies the lower bound of the threshold for Scalar 1.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: UpperThreshold1
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Upper Threshold 1
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property specifies the upper bound of the threshold for Scalar 1.

IntVectorProperty.name: InsideOut
IntVectorProperty.label: Exclude Range (Inverse) 1
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If this option is selected only scalars in Scalar 1 below the Lower Threshold and above the Upper Threshold will be retained.

IntVectorProperty.name: FilterMode
IntVectorProperty.label: Filter Mode
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This specifies how to combine the two scalars. "And" will retain only cells that pass the threshold for both scalars. "Or" retains cells that pass the threshold for either scalar. "Only Scalar 1" ignores Scalar 2 and "Only Scalar 2" ignores Scalar 1.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputScalars2
StringVectorProperty.label: Scalars 2
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property contains the name of the second scalar array from which to perform thresholding.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: ThresholdBetween2
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Threshold Range 2
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The values of this property specify the upper and lower bounds of the thresholding operation for Scalar 2.

IntVectorProperty.name: InsideOut2
IntVectorProperty.label: Exclude Range (Inverse) 2
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If this option is selected only scalars in Scalar 2 below the Lower Threshold and above the Upper Threshold will be retained.

StringVectorProperty.name: ResultArrayName
StringVectorProperty.label: Result Array Name
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This allows you to change the name of the resulting array.

SourceProxy.name: ConnectedThreshold
SourceProxy.label: Connected Threshold

Documentation.long_help: This filter extracts cells that have cell scalars in the specified range and are all connected to each other.
Documentation.short_help: Extract connected cells that satisfy a threshold criterion.

SourceProxy.Documentation:
The Connected Threshold filter extracts the portions of the input dataset whose scalars lie within the specified range. Each connected group is numbered in the output array. This filter operates only on cell-centered data. The input must be Image Data or a Rectilinear Grid. The resulting output type is the same as the input.
The filter can be set on two different scalars from the same object. The Lower Threshold and Upper Threshold sliders determine the range of the scalars to retain in the output. The Exclude Range checkbox will cause only the scalars below the Lower Threshold and above the Upper Threshold to be retained in the output.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to be evaluated by the Connected Threshold filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputScalars
StringVectorProperty.label: Scalars 1
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property contains the name of the scalar array from which to perform thresholding.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputScalars2
StringVectorProperty.label: Scalars 2
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property contains the name of the second scalar array from which to perform thresholding.

IntVectorProperty.name: FilterMode
IntVectorProperty.label: Filter Mode
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This specifies how to combine the two scalars. "And" will retain only cells that pass the threshold for both scalars. "Or" retains cells that pass the threshold for either scalar. "Only Scalar 1" ignores Scalar 2 and "Only Scalar 2" ignores Scalar 1.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: ThresholdBetween
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Threshold Range 1
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The values of this property specify the upper and lower bounds of the thresholding operation for Scalar 1.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: ThresholdBetween2
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Threshold Range 2
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The values of this property specify the upper and lower bounds of the thresholding operation for Scalar 2.

IntVectorProperty.name: InsideOut
IntVectorProperty.label: Exclude Range (Inverse) 1
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If this option is selected only scalars in Scalar 1 below the Lower Threshold and above the Upper Threshold will be retained.

IntVectorProperty.name: InsideOut2
IntVectorProperty.label: Exclude Range (Inverse) 2
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If this option is selected only scalars in Scalar 2 below the Lower Threshold and above the Upper Threshold will be retained.

StringVectorProperty.name: ResultArrayName
StringVectorProperty.label: Result Array Name
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This allows you to change the name of the resulting array.

SourceProxy.name: Sum
SourceProxy.label: Sum

Documentation.long_help: This filter calculates the sum of each array.
Documentation.short_help: Calculate the sum of each array.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Sum filter calculates the total sum of each Point Data and Cell Data array and displays the results in Field Data.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the Sum filter.
